text: there's a strange phenomenon that
happens occasionally in modern cinema to
very similar films get made around the
same time maybe sometimes it's a
coincidence or maybe sometimes a film
studio gets wind of a rival Studios
upcoming project and they think they
need to produce something like it in
order to compete it's hard to say either
way I've noticed this strange trend in
the past examples would include
tombstone being followed by Wyatt Earp a
bug's life in ants a shark's tail in
Finding Nemo Red Planet and mission to
Mars Dante's Peak and volcano the
prestige and The Illusionist White House
down and Olympus has fallen World Trade
Center and United 93 and the two films
I'm going to compare today Deep Impact
and Armageddon first it's time for a
word from our sponsor for this video

these are disaster movies about
basically the same thing earth is about
to get hit by a large piece of rock from
space that will produce an extinction
level event and NASA have to send a
manned mission to that rock to try to
destroy it with powerful nuclear
warheads and deep impact the object is a
comet the size of Everest and in
Armageddon it's an asteroid the size of
Texas on paper these films are
essentially the same story but they
differ drastically in terms of how
they're interpreted and executed by the
filmmakers though both films were highly
successful at the box office the Bruce
Willis led Armageddon was by far the
more profitable and well known of the
two-hour mageddon is a mess I've always
found it to be
cringe-inducing cheesy brainless action
popcorn film that was fun but
forgettable it's a theme park action
ride deep impact is an actual serious
drama that presents a more realistic
take on the concept and focuses on the
lives of the characters and how the
impending doom affects them it's a much
more emotionally intense and somber
interpretation that I've grown to
appreciate far more than Armageddon
director Michael Bay is known for
ludicrously fast-paced CGI action films
that are loud melodramatic and
over-the-top Armageddon is Michael Bay
turned up to 11 the entire film is
directed
edited and even color graded like a
music video I was 15 when I saw it first
and generally really enjoyed it but I
was a kid back then as the years have
gone on I find the film practically
unwatchable it was on TV recently and I
watched the last 30 minutes or so and I
found myself for the first time asking
the question was this film actually a
spoof all along and I just didn't
realize it every scene in the film is
over acted over edited and over directed
with gratuitous use of close-ups and
dramatic music Bruce Willis gives the
happiest hard-edged performance of his
life and it actually seems like it's on
purpose at no point does this film even
remotely attempt to take itself
seriously even for a second the film's
premise is that NASA needs to enlist the
help of the world's best deep core
drillers to be trained as astronauts and
sent to the asteroid where they'll
attempt to dig a massive hole in its
surface and drop a nuke the film
extracts some laughs from the idea that
these guys are the wrong people to be
saving the world our heroes are a ragtag
group of average joes a likeable bunch
of rough-and-ready guys with the odd
eccentric thrown in the film is
genuinely funny in the first hour as
they have to go through rigorous
training and psychological evaluations
with some hilarious consequences the
heart of the film is a love story
between then newcomer Ben Affleck who
plays AJ and Liv Tyler who plays grace
grace is the daughter of Bruce Willis's
character Harry Stamper who doesn't
approve of their relationship and has
numerous run-ins with AJ throughout the
film there's no doubt that Armageddon
was successful because it was a Bruce
Willis vehicle film it boasts some
entertaining action set-pieces the CGI
still holds
and there's some humorous moments but
it's as if the filmmakers were actively
trying to parody the story idea rather
than make a serious science fiction film
about the idea of Earth facing an
imminent asteroid impact it's also laced
with scientific inaccuracies but I can
forgive that kind of stuff
Armageddon is like Marmite it polarizes
audiences and generally I've come to
dislike the film over the years I
actually feel myself getting Dumber as I
watch it you have to turn your brain off
to enjoy this kind of movie it's filled
with cliches and hammy dialogue to the
point of being just as wince-inducing
Lee cringy as Batman and Robin deep
impact is practically a docudrama by
comparison
directed by Mimi Letter it focuses more
on the earthbound drama rather than the
stuff happening in space although
there's still plenty of that as well
the primary character is Tia Leone's
Jenny Lerner a reporter with MSNBC ya
MSNBC let's just move swiftly on anyway
Lerner accidentally stumbles across a
government scandal that's being covered
up the mysterious resignation of
secretary of the Treasury Alain
Rittenhouse Rittenhouse the
time-traveling bad guys from timeless no
but whenever I hear that name that's
exactly what I think anyway Lerner only
has a name Ellie who she thinks is the
mistress of Rittenhouse and perhaps this
scandal is simply an affair he's having
with her except Ellie isn't as she so
much as a wot eventually she's
confronted by the president much to her
shock and she's told to bury the story
for fear of creating widespread public
panic of course the president doesn't
realize that learner knows much less
than what she's letting on following
some further research she discovers that
Ellie is an abbreviation for extinction
level event two days later the president
goes public with the story and explains
that a comet is about to collide with
the earth in ten months the first plan
is to send a crew of astronauts in a
ship called the Messiah they'll do
essentially the same thing as the crew
from the two shuttles in Armageddon but
it turns out they don't need deep core
drillers because honestly how hard can
it be to point a drill into the ground
and switch it on
if highly-trained super intelligent NASA
astronauts can't learn how to do that
then humanity has
absolutely no hope of survival this
really does show up the stupidity of
Armageddon deep impact also prioritizes
certain story elements than Armageddon
doesn't Michael Bay wanted to ensure
that the president in his film had very
little screen time by comparison the
president in deep impact played by
Morgan Freeman is a major character
although as the film goes on his role is
reduced to being a little more than an
exposition function offering plot
updates on how the mission is going that
function more like captain's logs
additionally Armageddon only has one
small scene featuring the character who
discovered the asteroid in deep impact
the comet is discovered by two people
dr. Marcus wolf who's killed in the
beginning of the movie and a young
astronomer Leo Biederman played by
Elijah Wood Leo is a central character
and becomes a local celebrity his story
arc is entirely divorced from Genny
learners and the two characters never
meet which i think is interesting and
gives the film a more expansive scope
it's essentially three stories all
interconnected the Massiah crew Jenny's
story including her relationship with
her parents and Leo story the Messiah's
mission is a failure one of the crew has
lost one is left permanently blind and
the comet is merely broken in two rather
than destroyed Robert Duvall's character
of Spurgeon tanner has to take command
of the mission the president reveals a
back-up plan with the impact of the
first piece of the comet imminent a
national lottery is devised in which 1
million citizens will be selected at
random to live inside some underground
caves for 2 years which should be long
enough for the dust to settle they will
then return to the surface and
repopulate the planet that's the plan
unlike Armageddon Deep Impact gives us a
brief glimpse into the kinds of chaos
pandemonium and breakdown in social
order that would arise during a
potential world ending catastrophe
though it's not focused on heavily we're
told that rioting and looting is taking
place in major cities the president
declares martial law and places a freeze
on all salaries and prizes the state is
forced to take control of society to
retain law and order though it's not a
significant aspect of the film I did
appreciate that it was at least
mentioned unlike Armageddon which comes
across as even more cartoonish and less
realistic for not addressing this the
rest of Deep Impact is bolstered by
solid performances from the cast
the first comet hits and delivers
widespread devastation on both sides of
the Atlantic the CGI is not nearly as
good as in Armageddon in some places
it's great but in others it's a bit
dated but it still works Jenny Lerner
sacrifices her place in the Ark and
gives it to her colleague who has a
daughter and following the suicide of
her mother she spends her final moments
with her estranged father in their
family home by the beach they're the two
of them reconcile in an emotional moment
that I found incredibly poignant they
face the end together as the tsunami
approaches the late Maximilian schnell
is brilliant as always and both he and
Leonie
deliver performances that hit the
perfect emotional mark without over
playing anything Leo Biederman returns
from the ark to rescue his girlfriend
Sarah
and there's another tear jerking scene
in which her parents tell her to go with
him and they give them the baby to look
after the parents sacrificing themselves
for the good of their children while
Armageddon is a paint-by-numbers action
film about trying to destroy an asteroid
before hits earth deep impact is a film
that explores and celebrates what's
really important in life in the face of
world ending disaster and so every major
character in the film is a hero in their
own story not just the brave astronauts
in a messiah I really appreciated the
completion of Spurgeon Tanner's arc
he was a veteran from the moon missions
and was largely placed on the masaya
mission as a PR exercise for an older
generation of Americans who would
remember him the younger crew grow to
appreciate his wisdom and leadership
especially commander Oren Monash who had
been his biggest critic prior to the
mission following Minaj's injury he
bonds with Tanner in a great scene on
the masaya while Tanner reads him the
opening chapter of Moby Dick each of the
astronauts say their final goodbyes to
their family back in Houston and then
take their remaining nukes and Ram the
larger comet destroying it the late
James Horner knocks this film's musical
score out of the park and although I
very much liked the more bombastic music
from Armageddon there's a great urgency
and intensity to the soundtrack of deep
impact I think some of the musical
elements slightly resemble Titanic in
places which is no bad thing because
Titanic has a phenomenal score
the reason I focused much more on deep
impact in this comparison review is
because quite honestly there's a lot
more story to unpack and deep impact
because the film focuses much more on
its characters than Armageddon does but
surprisingly some of its critics
complain that deep impact takes itself
too seriously and that it becomes too
overly sentimental and instead they
appreciate the more illustrious
Armageddon because it's fun and less
somber I actually don't really
understand this criticism because I
believe deep impact takes the impending
threat of Earth's destruction about as
seriously as it should be taken by
comparison
Armageddon turns the entire affair into
a bit of a slapstick joke of course you
could enjoy both films but I'm obviously
more partial to deep impact so let me
know your thoughts on these movies in
the comments below which did you prefer
and I'll see you next time bye bye
